messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: Now NASA is working towards recording some of the smaller asteroids that are at least 140 metres wide. NASA estimates there are about 25,000 of this size, and so far it has recorded around 8,000, which means 17,000 are still not known. In 2013, a 19-metre asteroid exploded above Chelyabinsk and injured 1,200 people, so these middle-sized asteroids could be very dangerous if they enter Earth's orbit.

metadata.feedback_text:
FAIL: CEFR Compliance. The text was classified as B2 likely because of its complex sentence structures and connectors. For example, the second sentence uses a nonrestrictive clause with “which means” and long numerical phrases: “NASA estimates there are about 25,000 of this size, and so far it has recorded around 8,000, which means 17,000 are still not known.” This structure pushes the level above B1. To correct this, split such sentences into shorter, simpler statements. For example:
Rewrite the estimation as two sentences: “NASA estimates there are about 25,000 asteroids of this size. So far, it has recorded around 8,000. That leaves 17,000 not yet known.”
Also split the final complex sentence into smaller ones: “In 2013, a 19-metre asteroid exploded above Chelyabinsk in Russia. It injured 1,200 people. These middle-sized asteroids could be very dangerous if they enter Earth’s orbit.”
These changes will simplify the structures and align the text with B1 requirements.
